cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing
A local habitation and a name."
—William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream

rulings.text: The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature neither deals nor receives combat damage.

cards.name: Glacial Wall
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
"As we neared, Belfar proclaimed the wall to be made of glass and went forward to prove it. We had no choice but to pull his hands free from where he had touched it, leaving flesh palmprints on the icy wall."
—Tross, Vainus Expedition leader

cards.name: Homarid Warrior
cards.text: {U}: Homarid Warrior gains shroud until end of turn and doesn't untap during your next untap step. Tap Homarid Warrior. (A creature with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

rulings.text: It taps when the ability resolves if it was not already tapped. It may be used even if it is already tapped.
Does not cause Auras on it to be removed when the effect is activated. An Aura on the battlefield is neither a spell nor an ability.

cards.originalText: {U}: Homarid Warrior cannot be the target of spells or effects until end of turn and does not untap during your next untap phase. Tap Homarid Warrior.

cards.name: Hurkyl's Recall
cards.text: Return all artifacts target player owns to their hand.
cards.flavor: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

rulings.text: Retrieves all artifacts owned by the target player regardless of who controls them. Ignores artifacts owned by other players even if target player has control of them.
It only returns artifacts which are on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Return to target player's hand all artifacts in play he or she owns.

cards.name: Hydroblast
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Counter target spell if it's red.
• Destroy target permanent if it's red.
cards.flavor:
"Heed the lessons of our time: the forms of water may move the land itself and hold captive the fires within."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter,
Kjeldoran royal mage

rulings.text: The decision to counter a spell or destroy a permanent is a decision made on announcement before the target is selected. If the spell is redirected, this mode can't be changed, so only targets of the selected type are valid.
Hydroblast can target any spell or permanent, not just a red one. It checks the color of the target only on resolution.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell if it is red, or destroy target permanent if it is red. (If this spell targets a permanent, play it as an instant.)

cards.name: Juxtapose
cards.text: You and target player exchange control of the creature you each control with the highest converted mana cost. Then exchange control of artifacts the same way. If two or more permanents a player controls are tied for highest cost, their controller chooses one of them.

rulings.text: First creatures are exchanged, then artifacts are exchanged. It's possible that the same artifact creature may be involved in both exchanges.
No permanents are targeted by this effect, so permanents with Shroud may be exchanged this way.

If one of the players doesn't control a creature at the time the exchange would be made, that part of the effect does nothing, but the exchange of artifacts will still happen. Similarly, if one of the players doesn't control an artifact at the time the exchange would be made, that part of the effect does nothing.

cards.originalText: Exchange with target player control of the creature with the highest total casting cost that you each control. If two or more creatures are tied for highest total casting cost creature a player controls, he or she chooses between them. Exchange control of artifacts in the same way.

cards.name: Krovikan Sorcerer
cards.text:
{T}, Discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Discard a black card: Draw two cards, then discard one of them.
cards.originalText:
{T}, Choose and discard a nonblack card: Draw a card.
{T}, Choose and discard a black card: Draw two cards, then choose and discard one of them.

cards.name: Labyrinth Minotaur
cards.text: Whenever Labyrinth Minotaur blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I doubt any labyrinth minotaurs still live—but then we minotaurs are stubborn beings."
—Onatah, Anaba shaman

rulings.text: If the creature Labyrinth Minotaur blocked is untapped at the time its controller's next untap step begins, this ability has no effect. It won't apply at some later time when that creature is tapped.

Labyrinth Minotaur doesn't track the creature's controller. If the affected creature changes controllers before its old controller's next untap step, this ability will prevent it from being untapped during its new controller's next untap step.

cards.originalText: If Labyrinth Minotaur blocks any creature, that creature does not untap during its controller's next untap phase.

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

rulings.text: You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

cards.originalText:
Trample
Leviathan comes into play tapped and does not untap during your untap phase.
Leviathan cannot attack this turn unless you sacrifice two islands.
Sacrifice two islands: Untap Leviathan. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Lifetap
cards.text: Whenever a Forest an opponent controls becomes tapped, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"Keep a green tree in your heart and perhaps the singing bird will come."
—Chinese proverb

rulings.text: Gives one life for each and every Forest tapped.
In multi-player games it affects all opponents.

cards.originalText: Whenever any forest target opponent controls becomes tapped, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Lord of Atlantis
cards.text: Other Merfolk creatures get +1/+1 and have islandwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor:
"'We have no legs,' the warrior spat, 'for we have finished running.'"
—Vodalian folktale
cards.originalText: All Merfolk get +1/+1 and gain islandwalk. (If defending player controls any islands, these creatures are unblockable.)

cards.name: Magical Hack
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.
You can't change proper nouns (i.e. card names) such as "Island Fish Jasconius".

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.
It can be used to change a land's type from one basic land type to another. For example, Forest can be changed to Island so it produces blue mana. It doesn't change the name of any permanent.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target permanent or spell by replacing all instances of one basic land type with another. (For example, you may change "swampwalk" to "plainswalk." If this spell targets a permanent, play it as an instant.)

cards.name: Magus of the Unseen
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the artifact, tap it.

rulings.text: You may target an untapped artifact with this ability.
The artifact taps after returning to the opponent (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the artifact when you lose control of it for any reason — because Magus of the Unseen's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.
The artifact will gain haste whether or not it's a creature. Of course, if it's not a creature, haste will have no particular effect.

cards.originalText: {1}{U}, {T}: Untap target artifact an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That artifact is unaffected by summoning sickness this turn. Tap the artifact if you lose control of it at end of this turn.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.
cards.flavor:
"Oh, I had a conscience once. But alas, I seem to have forgotten where I put it."
—Chandler

rulings.text: Memory Lapse has a self-replacement effect that replaces the spell going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If the spell was cast using flashback, however, flashback will change the spell's destination from its owner's library to exile.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell. Put that spell on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Mind Bomb
cards.text: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards they discarded this way.
cards.originalText: Mind Bomb deals 3 damage to each player. Each player may choose and discard up to three cards to prevent that amount of damage to him or her from Mind Bomb.

cards.name: Phantasmal Forces
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.
cards.flavor: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.
cards.originalText:
Flying
During your upkeep, pay {U} or bury Phantasmal Forces.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land
As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.
Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.originalText: Enchanted land is a basic land type of your choice.

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe,
"The Haunted Palace"
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Pirate Ship
cards.text:
Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to any target.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.
cards.originalText:
Islandhome (If defending player controls no islands, this creature cannot attack. If you control no islands, bury this creature.)
{T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Portent
cards.text:
Look at the top three cards of target player's library, then put them back in any order. You may have that player shuffle their library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: This does not cause a player to lose if they have less than 3 cards in their library. It allows you to look at and reorder or shuffle whatever remaining cards there might be.

cards.originalText: Look at the top three cards of target player's library. Shuffle that library or put those three cards back on top of it in any order. Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless that spell's caster pays an additional {X}. That player draws and pays all mana from lands and mana pool until {X} is paid; he or she may also draw and pay mana from other sources if desired.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

cards.originalText: Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Ray of Command
cards.text: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature gains haste until end of turn. When you lose control of the creature, tap it.

rulings.text: You may target an untapped creature with Ray of Command.

The creature returns to the opponent when the "until end of turn" effect wears off during the cleanup step. It taps during the Cleanup step (if it is not already tapped), so any abilities triggered off it tapping happen at that time.
You tap the creature when you lose control of it for any reason — because Ray of Command's effect ends, or because a spell or ability causes another player to gain control of it.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature an opponent controls and gain control of it until end of turn. That creature is unaffected by summoning sickness this turn. Tap the creature if you lose control of it at end of this turn.

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

rulings.text: You don't discard cards until Recall resolves. If you don't have X cards in your hand at that time, you discard all the cards in your hand.

You don't choose which cards in your graveyard you'll return to your hand until after you discard cards. You choose a card in your graveyard for each card you discarded, then you put all cards chosen this way into your hand at the same time. You may choose to return some or all of the cards you just discarded.

cards.originalText: Choose and discard X cards: Return X target cards in your graveyard to your hand. Remove Recall from the game.

cards.name: Reef Pirates
cards.text: Whenever Reef Pirates deals damage to an opponent, that player puts the top card of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: Relentless as the tides, souls dark as a moonless night. Bloodshed on their minds, and greed burning in their hearts like molten gold.
cards.originalText: If Reef Pirates damages any opponent, put the top card of that player's library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target summon spell.

cards.name: Sea Serpent
cards.text:
Sea Serpent can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Sea Serpent.
cards.flavor: Legend has it that serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?
cards.originalText: Islandhome (If defending player controls no islands, this creature cannot attack. If you control no islands, bury this creature.)

cards.name: Sea Spirit
cards.text: {U}: Sea Spirit gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"It rose above our heads, above the ship, and still higher yet. No foggy, ice-laden sea in the world could frighten me more."
—General Jarkeld, the Arctic Fox
cards.originalText: {U}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Sea Sprite
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"No one can catch what won't be caught."
—Kakra, sea troll
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Seasinger
cards.text:
When you control no Islands, sacrifice Seasinger.
You may choose not to untap Seasinger during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target creature whose controller controls an Island for as long as you control Seasinger and Seasinger remains tapped.

rulings.text: You do not lose control of the stolen creature if it stops being a creature. You only lose control if Seasinger leaves your control or becomes untapped.

If a creature's controller doesn't control an Island, that creature is an illegal target. Whether that player controls an Island is checked both when Seasinger's ability is activated and when it resolves. However, targeting restrictions aren't checked continually while a spell or ability is on the stack.

Whether you control Seasinger is checked continually, starting when the ability is activated. If, before the ability resolves, there's any point at which you don't control Seasinger, the ability has no effect — even if you control Seasinger again by the time the ability resolves. The same is true regarding whether Seasinger remains tapped.

cards.originalText:
If you control no islands, bury Seasinger.
You may choose not to untap Seasinger during your untap phase.
{T}: Gain control of target creature whose controller controls any islands as long as you control Seasinger and Seasinger remains tapped.

cards.name: Segovian Leviathan
cards.text: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
cards.flavor: "Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?" —The Bible, Job 41:1
cards.originalText: Islandwalk (If defending player controls any islands, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Sibilant Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.
cards.flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

rulings.text: Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Sibilant Spirit attacks, defending player may draw a card.

cards.name: Sleight of Mind
cards.text: Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "target black spell" to "target blue spell." This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: You can't Sleight proper nouns (i.e. card names). This means that you can't affect a "Black Vise".
Can target a card with no color words on it.
Can't change a color word to the same color word. It must be a different word.
Alters all occurrences of the chosen word in the text box and the type line of the given card.
Can target a card with no appropriate words on it, or even one with no words at all.
It can't change a word to the same word. It must be a different word.
It only changes what is printed on the card (or set on a token when it was created or set by a copy effect). It will not change any effects that are on the permanent.
You choose the words to change on resolution.

Changing the text of a spell will not allow you to change the targets of the spell because the targets were chosen when the spell was cast. The text change will (probably) cause it to be countered since the targets will be illegal.
If you change the text of a spell which is to become a permanent, the permanent will retain the text change until the effect wears off.

cards.originalText: Change the text of target permanent or spell by replacing all instances of one color word with another. (For example, you may change "nongreen creature" to "nonred creature." If this spell targets a permanent, play it as an instant.)

cards.name: Soul Barrier
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a creature spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to that player unless they pay {2}.
cards.flavor:
"The Soul selects her own Society—
Then—shuts the Door—"
—Emily Dickinson,
"The Soul selects her own Society"

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.originalText: Whenever target opponent successfully casts a summon spell, Soul Barrier deals 2 damage to him or her. That player may pay {2} to prevent this damage.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X. (For example, if that spell's mana cost is {3}{U}{U}, X is 5.)

rulings.text: Alternative costs, additional costs, cost increases, and cost reductions don't affect a spell's converted mana cost.

If the target spell has {X} in its mana cost, include the value chosen for that X when determining the value of the {X} in Spell Blast's mana cost. For example, if you wish to counter Volcanic Geyser (a spell with mana cost {X}{R}{R}) whose X is 7, you'll need to choose 9 for Spell Blast's X and pay {9}{U}.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell with total casting cost equal to X.

cards.name: Stasis
cards.text:
Players skip their untap steps.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Stasis unless you pay {U}.

rulings.text: Since there is no untap step, Phasing in/out won't happen.
Does not prevent cards from being untapped outside the untap step.

cards.originalText:
Each player skips his or her untap phase.
During your upkeep, pay {U} or bury Stasis.

cards.name: Steal Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
You control enchanted artifact.

rulings.text: Can be used on artifact creatures.

cards.originalText: Gain control of enchanted artifact.

cards.name: Time Elemental
cards.text:
When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: You both sacrifice it and deal the 5 damage at end of combat.
A "permanent that isn't enchanted" is a permanent with no Auras on it.
If Time Elemental attacks or blocks, but you no longer control it at end of combat, you can't sacrifice it. However, it will still deal 5 damage to you.

cards.originalText:
If Time Elemental attacks or blocks, it deals 5 damage to you and is buried at end of combat.
{2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent with no enchantments on it to owner's hand.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Unstable Mutation
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, put a -1/-1 counter on that creature.

rulings.text: The -1/-1 counters stay even if the Aura is removed, and the +3/+3 goes away when the Aura does.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.
During its controller's upkeep, put a -1/-1 counter on enchanted creature.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target creature to owner's hand.

cards.name: Updraft
cards.text:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Come one, come all! this rock shall fly From its firm base as soon as I."
—Sir Walter Scott, "The Lady of the Lake"
cards.originalText:
Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Vodalian Soldiers
cards.flavor:
"Vodalian rank is displayed by the colors and patterns of their skin. Beware the color red; that is the badge of the empress's favor."
—Corbio, pearl diver

cards.name: Wall of Air
cards.text: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
When no falcons fly, beware the sky.
—Femeref aphorism
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Wind Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor:
" . . . When the trees bow down their heads, / The wind is passing by."
—Christina Rossetti,
"Who Has Seen the Wind?"
cards.originalText:
Flying
Wind Spirit cannot be blocked by only one creature.

cards.name: Zephyr Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the zephyr falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Zephyr Falcon to tap.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.
If a player would draw a card, they reveal it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is a continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices. You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement. If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.

cards.originalText:
Players play with their hands face up.
Whenever any player draws a card, any other player may pay 2 life to force the drawing player to discard that card.

cards.name: An-Havva Constable
cards.text: An-Havva Constable's toughness is equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures on the battlefield.
cards.flavor:
"Joskun and the other constables serve with passion, if not with grace."
—Devin, faerie noble
cards.originalText: An-Havva Constable has toughness equal to 1 plus the number of green creatures in play.

cards.name: Aspect of Wolf
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

rulings.text: The effect is continuously updated based on the number of Forests you control at any given time.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +*/+*, where * is equal to half the number of forests you control, rounded down for power and up for toughness.

cards.name: Aurochs
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other attacking Aurochs.
cards.flavor: One auroch may feed a village, but a herd will flatten it.

rulings.text: The bonus is not applied until after you check for attack legality, so it is a 2/3 creature when declaring attackers.
The ability counts the number of attacking creatures with the creature type Aurochs, not just those named Aurochs.

cards.originalText:
Trample
If Aurochs attacks, it gets +1/+0 until end of turn for each other Aurochs that attacks.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Carapace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"Now that's a fashion statement."
—Devin, faerie noble

rulings.text: This leaves the battlefield when you activate its activated ability, but the enchanted creature won't be regenerated until the ability resolves. In the intervening time, the creature will no longer have the bonus that this had been giving it. This may cause the creature to be destroyed before the regeneration shield is created.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
Sacrifice Carapace: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Cat Warriors
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: These stealthy felines have survived so many battles that some believe they must possess many lives.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player controls any forests, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Chub Toad
cards.text: Whenever Chub Toad blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Chub toad, chub toad
At the door.
Run away quick
Or you'll run no more.
—Traditional children's rhyme
cards.originalText: If Chub Toad blocks or is blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.originalText:
Flying
If Cockatrice blocks or is blocked by any non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Craw Giant
cards.text:
Trample
Rampage 2 (Whenever this creature becomes blocked, it gets +2/+2 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.)
cards.flavor: Harthag gave a jolly laugh as he surveyed the army before him. "Ho ho ho! Midgets! You think you can stand in my way?"
cards.originalText: Trample; rampage 2 (For each creature assigned to block it beyond the first, this creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Craw Wurm
cards.flavor: The most terrifying thing about the craw wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

cards.name: Crumble
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"Ashes and dust; dust and ashes.
Hope it works before it smashes."
—Argivian children's rhyme

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, the player does not gain any life.

cards.originalText: Bury target artifact. That artifact's controller gains an amount of life equal to its total casting cost.

cards.name: Desert Twister
cards.text: Destroy target permanent.
cards.originalText: Destroy target permanent.

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—The Bible, Mark 5:13

cards.name: Elder Druid
cards.text: {3}{G}, {T}: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.
cards.flavor:
"Did clouds dance in his eyes,
did thorns play at his fingertips?"
—Shesul Fass, faerie band

rulings.text: The decision of whether to tap or untap is made on resolution.

cards.originalText: {3}{G}, {T}: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm.
—Elven proverb

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Elven Riders cannot be blocked except by Walls or creatures with flying.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.originalText: Creatures deal no combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"It blinked, and flower petals fell like tears. Harthar, sensing weakness, attacked—and his blood fell like petals."
—Shesul Fass, faerie bard
cards.originalText:
Trample
During your upkeep, pay {G}{G}{G}{G} or Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you.

cards.name: Foxfire
cards.text:
Untap target attacking creature. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Only the foolish fear foxfire."
—Kolbjörn,
Elder Druid of the Juniper Order
cards.originalText:
Untap target attacking creature. That creature neither deals nor receives combat damage this turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn.

cards.name: Fungusaur
cards.text: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Rather than sheltering her young, the female fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

rulings.text: If more than one creature damages it at one time, it only gets one counter.

cards.originalText: At the end of any turn in which Fungusaur was damaged, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Fyndhorn Elder
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"Do we know what we're doing? Yes—the will of Freyalise."
—Laina of the Elvish Council
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G}{G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Ghazbán Ogre
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if a player has more life than each other player, the player with the most life gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.
cards.flavor:
"We were holding our own—until the ogre guiding us suddenly grinned and turned on our commander."
—Ivra Jursdotter, Sarpadian mercenary
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, if a player has more life than any other, he or she gains control of Ghazbán Ogre.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Giant Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: While it possesses potent venom, the giant spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.originalText: Giant Spider can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominaria's grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Hungry Mist
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Hungry Mist unless you pay {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"All things must eat, after all. Even the air can hunger."
—Gemma, Willow priestess
cards.originalText: During your upkeep, pay {G}{G} or bury Hungry Mist.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
"The raging winds . . . , settling on the sea, the surges sweep, / Raise liquid mountains, and disclose the deep."
—Virgil, Aeneid, Book I, trans. Dryden

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Instill Energy
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

rulings.text: If attached to an opponent's creature, you can untap their creature during your turn.
Instill Energy's untap ability will not untap the creature until it resolves. This means other spells and abilities can be used before it actually becomes untapped.

Any Auras (or other effects) which are on the creature that would cause it to not be untapped (or have a cost to be untapped) during untap step do not in any way hinder or imply a cost to use this card's ability to untap once during the turn.

cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature is unaffected by summoning sickness.
{0}: Untap enchanted creature. Use this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

cards.name: Ironroot Treefolk
cards.flavor:
"'I'll show you how to handle the treefolk!' the giant bragged, and he strode off into the forest. Two days later he returned, his face masked in sap and a nest behind his ear. None dared ask who won."
—Azeworai, "The Treeling"

cards.name: Johtull Wurm
cards.text: Whenever Johtull Wurm becomes blocked, it gets -2/-1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it beyond the first.
cards.flavor:
"To bring her down we must be on all sides at once—leave one avenue open and we'll all be dead."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
cards.originalText: For each creature assigned to block it beyond the first, Johtull Wurm gets -2/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Killer Bees
cards.text:
Flying
{G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.
cards.originalText:
Flying
{G}: +1/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Ley Druid
cards.text: {T}: Untap target land.
cards.flavor: After years of training, the druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

rulings.text: The land is untapped as a normal ability that goes on the stack. It is not a mana ability, so it can't be used at times that only mana abilities can be used.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap target land.

cards.name: Lhurgoyf
cards.text: Lhurgoyf's power is equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and its toughness is equal to that number plus 1.
cards.flavor:
"Ach! Hans, run! It's the lhurgoyf!"
—Saffi Eriksdotter, last words
cards.originalText: Lhurgoyf has power equal to the number of creature cards in all graveyards and toughness equal to 1 plus the number of creature cards in all graveyards.

cards.name: Lifeforce
cards.text: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell.
cards.flavor:
"Every fallen tree nourishes a thousand seedlings."
—Autumn Willow to Baron Sengir
cards.originalText: {G}{G}: Counter target black spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Living Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You can cast it targeting your opponent's artifacts. The controller of the Aura (not the controller of the artifact) controls the Living Artifact ability.
Does not trigger on loss of life, just on damage.

cards.originalText:
For each 1 damage dealt to you, put a vitality counter on Living Artifact.
Remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact: Gain 1 life. Use this ability only during your upkeep and only once each turn.

cards.name: Living Lands
cards.text: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

cards.originalText: All forests are 1/1 creatures. (These creatures still count as lands.)

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature
All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor:
"When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait."
—Geyadrone Dihada

rulings.text: Lure doesn't give any creatures the ability to block the target creature. It just forces those creatures that are already able to block the creature to do so.

As blockers are declared, any creature that's tapped or affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, no player is forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block if that cost isn't paid.

cards.originalText: All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.name: Marsh Viper
cards.text: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)
cards.flavor:
"And the seraphs sob at vermin fangs
In human gore imbued."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Conqueror Wurm"
cards.originalText: If Marsh Viper damages any player, he or she gets two poison counters. If any player has ten or more poison counters, he or she loses the game.

cards.name: Nature's Lore
cards.text: Search your library for a Forest card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"It is in our nature to recognize beauty, but to repeat it—ah, that is another feat altogether."
—Hannah of Verdura

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

You can find any card with the land type Forest, including Snow-covered Forest or non-Basic lands like Tropical Island, Murmuring Bosk, or Stomping Ground. You can even find a card that is a land in addition to other types, such as Dryad Arbor.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a forest card and put that card into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Pradesh Gypsies
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."
—Lord Magnus of Llanowar
cards.originalText: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Primal Order
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals damage to that player equal to the number of nonbasic lands they control.
cards.flavor:
"My sorrow: to dream of simple times, and wake in mine . . . ."
—Ola DaRiol, "Regrets"
cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, Primal Order deals to that player an amount of damage equal to the number of nonbasic lands he or she controls.

cards.name: Rabid Wombat
cards.text:
Vigilance
Rabid Wombat gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

rulings.text: If an Aura is removed from the Wombat, its power and toughness change immediately.

cards.originalText:
Attacking does not cause Rabid Wombat to tap.
Rabid Wombat gets +2/+2 for each creature enchantment on it.

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Crawing, crawing,
For my crowse crawing,
I lost the best feather i' my wing
For my crowse crawing."
—Anonymous Scottish ballad

rulings.text: Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.originalText: {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these
wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Scavenger Folk
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
"Stoop, pick, turn, toss.
This is the way we mourn our loss."
—Scavenger dirge
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Scavenger Folk: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.
cards.originalText: Forestwalk (If defending player controls any forests, this creature is unblockable.)

cards.name: Shrink
cards.text: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"May you decrease like coal upon the hearth . . . Evaporate like water in a pail, Become as little as a linseed-grain . . . And so diminish that you come to nothing."
—Anglo-Saxon curse
cards.originalText: Target creature gets -5/-0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Stampede
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"When are beasts like a river?"
—The One Thousand Questions
cards.originalText: All attacking creatures get +1/+0 and gain trample until end of turn.
